metadata.title: Giải đề Cambridge IELTS 19 – Test 1: Reading Passage 2 – The pirates of the ancient Mediterranean

readingPassage.title: The pirates of the ancient Mediterranean
paragraphs: A. When one mentions pirates, an image springs to most people’s minds of a crew of misfits, daredevils and adventurers in command of a tall sailing ship in the Caribbean Sea. Yet from the first to the third millennium BCE, thousands of years before these swashbucklers began spreading fear across the Caribbean, pirates prowled the Mediterranean, raiding merchant ships and threatening vital trade routes. However, despite all efforts and the might of various ancient states, piracy could not be stopped. The situation remained unchanged for thousands of years. Only when the pirates directly threatened the interests of ancient Rome did the Roman Republic organise a massive fleet to eliminate piracy. Under the command of the Roman general Pompey, Rome eradicated piracy, transforming the Mediterranean into ‘Mare Nostrum’ (Our Sea).

B. Although piracy in the Mediterranean is first recorded in ancient Egypt during the reign of Pharaoh Amenhotep III (c 1390-1353 BCE), it is reasonable to assume it predated this powerful civilisation. This is partly due to the great importance the Mediterranean held at this time, and partly due to its geography. While the Mediterranean region is predominantly fertile, some parts are rugged and hilly, even mountainous. In the ancient times, the inhabitants of these areas relied heavily on marine resources, including fish and salt. Most had their own boats, possessed good seafaring skills, and unsurpassed knowledge of the local coastline and sailing routes. Thus, it is not surprising that during hardships, these men turned to piracy. Geography itself further benefited the pirates, with the numerous coves along the coast providing places for them to hide their boats and strike undetected. Before the invention of ocean-going caravels in the 15th century, ships could not easily cross long distances over open water. Thus, in the ancient world most were restricted to a few well- known navigable routes that followed the coastline. Caught in a trap, a slow merchant ship laden with goods had no other option but to surrender. In addition, knowledge of the local area helped the pirates to avoid retaliation once a state fleet arrived.

C. One should also add that it was not unknown in the first and second millennia BCE for governments to resort to pirates’ services, especially during wartime, employing their skills and numbers against their opponents. A pirate fleet would serve in the first wave of attack, preparing the way for the navy. Some of the regions were known for providing safe harbours to pirates, who, in return, boosted the local economy.

D. The first known record of a named group of Mediterranean pirates, made during the rule of ancient Egyptian Pharaoh Akhenaten (c 1353-1336 BCE), was in the Amarna Letters. These were extracts of diplomatic correspondence between the pharaoh and his allies, and covered many pressing issues, including piracy. It seems the pharaoh was troubled by two distinct pirate groups, the Lukka and the Sherden. Despite the Egyptian fleet’s best efforts, the pirates continued to cause substantial disruption to regional commerce. In the letters, the king of Alashiya (modern Cyprus) rejected Akhenaten’s claims of a connection with the Lukka (based in modern-day Turkey). The king assured Akhenaten he was prepared to punish any of his subjects involved in piracy.

E. The ancient Greek world’s experience of piracy was different from that of Egyptian rulers. While Egypt’s power was land-based, the ancient Greeks relied on the Mediterranean in almost all aspects of life, from trade to warfare. Interestingly, in his works the Iliad and the Odyssey, the ancient Greek writer Homer not only condones, but praises the lifestyle and actions of pirates. The opinion remained unchanged in the following centuries. The ancient Greek historian Thucydides, for instance, glorified pirates’ daring attacks on ships or even cities. For Greeks, piracy was a part of everyday life. Even high-ranking members of the state were not beyond engaging in such activities. According to the Greek orator Demosthenes, in 355 BCE, Athenian ambassadors made a detour from their official travel to capture a ship sailing from Egypt, taking the wealth found onboard for themselves! The Greeks’ liberal approach towards piracy does not mean they always tolerated it, but attempts to curtail piracy were hampered by the large number of pirates operating in the Mediterranean.

F. The rising power of ancient Rome required the Roman Republic to deal with piracy in the Mediterranean. While piracy was a serious issue for the Republic, Rome profited greatly from its existence. Pirate raids provided a steady source of slaves, essential for Rome’s agriculture and mining industries. But this arrangement could work only while the pirates left Roman interests alone. Pirate attacks on grain ships, which were essential to Roman citizens, led to angry voices in the Senate, demanding punishment of the culprits. Rome, however, did nothing, further encouraging piracy. By the 1st century BCE, emboldened pirates kidnapped prominent Roman dignitaries, asking for a large ransom to be paid. Their most famous hostage was none other than Julius Caesar, captured in 75 BCE.

G. By now, Rome was well aware that pirates had outlived their usefulness. The time had come for concerted action. In 67 BCE, a new law granted Pompey vast funds to combat the Mediterranean menace. Taking personal command, Pompey divided the entire Mediterranean into 13 districts, assigning a fleet and commander to each. After cleansing one district of pirates, the fleet would join another in the next district. The process continued until the entire Mediterranean was free of pirates. Although thousands of pirates died at the hands of Pompey’s troops, as a long-term solution to the problem, many more were offered land in fertile areas located far from the sea. Instead of a maritime menace, Rome got productive farmers that further boosted its economy.

questionGroups.instructions:
Reading Passage 2 has seven paragraphs, A-G.
Which paragraph contains the following information?
Write the correct letter, A-G, in boxes 14-19 on your answer sheet.
NB You may use any letter more than once.

questions.content: a reference to a denial of involvement in piracy
questions.guide:
Phân tích: Từ khóa là 'denial of involvement' (từ chối liên quan) và 'piracy' (cướp biển). Cần tìm đoạn văn có một bên phủ nhận sự liên quan đến cướp biển.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn D.

Trích dẫn: "In the letters, the king of Alashiya (modern Cyprus) rejected Akhenaten’s claims of a connection with the Lukka (based in modern-day Turkey)."

Kết luận: Vua của Alashiya đã 'rejected' (bác bỏ), đồng nghĩa với 'denial', lời cáo buộc về 'connection' (liên quan), với cướp biển Lukka. Do đó, đáp án là D.

questions.content: details of how a campaign to eradicate piracy was carried out
questions.guide:
Phân tích: Từ khóa là 'campaign to eradicate piracy' (chiến dịch xóa sổ cướp biển) và 'how... carried out' (cách thức tiến hành). Cần tìm đoạn văn mô tả chi tiết một chiến dịch quân sự.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn G.

Trích dẫn: "Taking personal command, Pompey divided the entire Mediterranean into 13 districts, assigning a fleet and commander to each. After cleansing one district of pirates, the fleet would join another in the next district."

Kết luận: Đoạn G mô tả rõ chiến lược của Pompey: chia Địa Trung Hải thành 13 quận và tiêu diệt cướp biển tuần tự từng quận. Đây chính là chi tiết về cách chiến dịch được thực hiện. Do đó, đáp án là G.

questions.content: a mention of the circumstances in which states in the ancient world would make use of pirates
questions.guide:
Phân tích: Từ khóa là 'circumstances' (hoàn cảnh), 'states... make use of pirates' (các nhà nước sử dụng cướp biển). Cần tìm đoạn văn nói về việc chính quyền thuê hoặc dùng cướp biển cho mục đích riêng.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn C.

Trích dẫn: "One should also add that it was not unknown in the first and second millennia BCE for governments to resort to pirates’ services, especially during wartime, employing their skills and numbers against their opponents."

Kết luận: Đoạn C nói rõ rằng các chính phủ đã sử dụng cướp biển, đặc biệt là trong thời chiến ('during wartime'). Do đó, đáp án là C.

questions.content: a reference to how people today commonly view pirates
questions.guide:
Phân tích: Từ khóa là 'how people today commonly view' (cách mọi người ngày nay thường nhìn nhận). Cần tìm đoạn văn mô tả hình ảnh phổ biến của cướp biển.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở câu đầu tiên của đoạn A.

Trích dẫn: "When one mentions pirates, an image springs to most people’s minds of a crew of misfits, daredevils and adventurers in command of a tall sailing ship in the Caribbean Sea."

Kết luận: Đoạn A mô tả hình ảnh hiện lên trong tâm trí của hầu hết mọi người ('most people's minds') khi nhắc đến cướp biển, đây chính là cách nhìn phổ biến ngày nay. Do đó, đáp án là A.

questions.content: an explanation of how some people were encouraged not to return to piracy
questions.guide:
Phân tích: Từ khóa là 'encouraged not to return to piracy' (được khuyến khích không quay lại làm cướp biển). Cần tìm một giải pháp lâu dài hoặc một sự ưu đãi để cướp biển từ bỏ nghề cũ.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở cuối đoạn G.

Trích dẫn: "...as a long-term solution to the problem, many more were offered land in fertile areas located far from the sea. Instead of a maritime menace, Rome got productive farmers..."

Kết luận: Rome đã cấp đất canh tác ('offered land') ở xa biển cho những tên cướp biển để họ trở thành nông dân, đây là cách khuyến khích họ không quay lại con đường cũ. Do đó, đáp án là G.

questions.content: a mention of the need for many sailing vessels to stay relatively close to land
questions.guide:
Phân tích: Từ khóa là 'need... to stay... close to land' (cần phải đi gần bờ). Cần tìm lý do tại sao các con tàu thời xưa phải di chuyển ven bờ.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn B.

Trích dẫn: "Before the invention of ocean-going caravels in the 15th century, ships could not easily cross long distances over open water. Thus, in the ancient world most were restricted to a few well- known navigable routes that followed the coastline."

Kết luận: Đoạn B giải thích rằng trước khi có các phát minh mới, tàu thuyền không thể dễ dàng đi qua vùng nước rộng lớn nên phải đi theo các tuyến đường ven bờ ('followed the coastline'). Do đó, đáp án là B.

questionGroups.instructions:
Which TWO of the following statements does the writer make about inhabitants of the Mediterranean region in the ancient world?
Choose TWO letters, A–E.

questions.content: Which TWO of the following statements does the writer make about inhabitants of the Mediterranean region in the ancient world? (Choice B)

options.A: They often used stolen vessels to carry out pirate attacks.
options.B: They managed to escape capture by the authorities because they knew the area so well.
options.C: They paid for information about the routes merchant ships would take.
options.D: They depended more on the sea for their livelihood than on farming.
options.E: They stored many of the goods taken in pirate attacks in coves along the coastline.

questions.guide:
Phân tích: Đối chiếu lựa chọn B 'managed to escape capture... because they knew the area so well' (trốn thoát... vì họ rất rành khu vực) với bài đọc.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở câu cuối của đoạn B.

Trích dẫn: "In addition, knowledge of the local area helped the pirates to avoid retaliation once a state fleet arrived."

Kết luận: 'knowledge of the local area' (sự am hiểu về khu vực địa phương) tương ứng với 'knew the area so well'. 'avoid retaliation' (tránh bị trả thù) tương ứng với 'escape capture'. Thông tin hoàn toàn trùng khớp. Do đó, đáp án là B.

questions.content: Which TWO of the following statements does the writer make about inhabitants of the Mediterranean region in the ancient world? (Choice D)

options.A: They often used stolen vessels to carry out pirate attacks.
options.B: They managed to escape capture by the authorities because they knew the area so well.
options.C: They paid for information about the routes merchant ships would take.
options.D: They depended more on the sea for their livelihood than on farming.
options.E: They stored many of the goods taken in pirate attacks in coves along the coastline.

questions.guide:
Phân tích: Đối chiếu lựa chọn D 'depended more on the sea... than on farming' (phụ thuộc vào biển nhiều hơn nông nghiệp) với bài đọc.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn B.

Trích dẫn: "While the Mediterranean region is predominantly fertile, some parts are rugged and hilly, even mountainous. In the ancient times, the inhabitants of these areas relied heavily on marine resources..."

Kết luận: Bài đọc nêu rõ một số khu vực có địa hình gồ ghề, đồi núi (ngụ ý khó làm nông nghiệp), nên cư dân ở đây 'relied heavily on marine resources' (phụ thuộc nhiều vào tài nguyên biển). Điều này ủng hộ lựa chọn D. Do đó, đáp án là D.

questionGroups.instructions:
Which TWO of the following statements does the writer make about piracy and ancient Greece?
Choose TWO letters, A–E.

questions.content: Which TWO of the following statements does the writer make about piracy and ancient Greece? (Choice C)

options.A: The state estimated that very few people were involved in piracy.
options.B: Attitudes towards piracy changed shortly after the Iliad and the Odyssey were written.
options.C: Important officials were known to occasionally take part in piracy.
options.D: Every citizen regarded pirate attacks on cities as unacceptable.
options.E: A favourable view of piracy is evident in certain ancient Greek texts.

questions.guide:
Phân tích: Đối chiếu lựa chọn C 'Important officials... take part in piracy' (Các quan chức quan trọng... tham gia cướp biển).

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn E.

Trích dẫn: "Even high-ranking members of the state were not beyond engaging in such activities."

Kết luận: 'high-ranking members of the state' đồng nghĩa với 'Important officials'. 'were not beyond engaging in such activities' có nghĩa là họ cũng tham gia vào các hoạt động đó (cướp biển). Thông tin hoàn toàn trùng khớp. Do đó, đáp án là C.

questions.content: Which TWO of the following statements does the writer make about piracy and ancient Greece? (Choice E)

options.A: The state estimated that very few people were involved in piracy.
options.B: Attitudes towards piracy changed shortly after the Iliad and the Odyssey were written.
options.C: Important officials were known to occasionally take part in piracy.
options.D: Every citizen regarded pirate attacks on cities as unacceptable.
options.E: A favourable view of piracy is evident in certain ancient Greek texts.

questions.guide:
Phân tích: Đối chiếu lựa chọn E 'A favourable view of piracy is evident in certain ancient Greek texts' (Có thể thấy một cái nhìn thiện cảm về cướp biển trong một số văn bản Hy Lạp cổ).

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn E.

Trích dẫn: "Interestingly, in his works the Iliad and the Odyssey, the ancient Greek writer Homer not only condones, but praises the lifestyle and actions of pirates."

Kết luận: Các tác phẩm ('texts') như Iliad và Odyssey đã 'praises' (ca ngợi) cướp biển, thể hiện một 'favourable view' (cái nhìn thiện cảm). Thông tin hoàn toàn trùng khớp. Do đó, đáp án là E.

questionGroups.instructions:
Complete the summary below.
Choose ONE WORD ONLY from the passage for each answer.

questions.content: Piracy was an issue ancient Rome had to deal with, but it also brought some benefits for Rome. For example, pirates supplied slaves that were important for Rome’s industries. However, attacks on vessels transporting ______ to Rome resulted in calls for
questions.guide:
Phân tích: Câu tóm tắt nói về các cuộc tấn công vào tàu bè vận chuyển một thứ gì đó ('vessels transporting ______') đến Rome. Ta cần tìm danh từ chỉ hàng hóa này.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn F.

Trích dẫn: "Pirate attacks on grain ships, which were essential to Roman citizens, led to angry voices in the Senate..."

Kết luận: Bài đọc nói rõ về 'attacks on grain ships' (các cuộc tấn công vào tàu chở ngũ cốc). Từ cần điền là 'grain'.

Phân tích: Câu tóm tắt đề cập đến việc có những lời kêu gọi ('calls for ______') dành cho những tên cướp biển phải chịu trách nhiệm. Ta cần tìm một danh từ chỉ hành động mà Thượng viện yêu cầu.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở đoạn F.

Trích dẫn: "...led to angry voices in the Senate, demanding punishment of the culprits."

Kết luận: 'demanding' (yêu cầu) tương ứng với 'calls for'. 'the culprits' (thủ phạm) tương ứng với 'the pirates responsible'. Từ cần điền là 'punishment' (sự trừng phạt).

questions.content: Nevertheless, piracy continued, with some pirates demanding a ______ for the return of the Roman officials they captured.
questions.guide:
Phân tích: Câu tóm tắt nói về việc cướp biển đòi hỏi ('demanding a ______') một thứ gì đó để trao trả các quan chức La Mã. 'captured' trong câu hỏi tương đương với 'kidnapped' trong bài đọc.

Vị trí: Thông tin nằm ở gần cuối đoạn F.

Trích dẫn: "By the 1st century BCE, emboldened pirates kidnapped prominent Roman dignitaries, asking for a large ransom to be paid."

Kết luận: Cướp biển đã 'asking for a large ransom' (đòi một khoản tiền chuộc lớn). Từ cần điền là 'ransom' (tiền chuộc).
